sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: I have a proposal for you, Adel.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: You see… I’m afraid that Eventyr’s great peril is my fault.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: Once, I was something more than this… I was a powerful spirit. A ruler, over a great stone city, with the forest as my domain.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: But my subjects wanted more. I was attacked. Nearly murdered. Nearly killed, for nothing more than a bloodied dream of conquest.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: I am forced to remain like this… small and forgotten. I have even forgotten my home. But you could help me, Adel, and in doing so, help Eventyr. Help your sister and her beloved town. Be the hero they’re so desperate for.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: I will give you power. Power and guidance. Abilities beyond anything you’ve ever seen… and the wisdom of a once-great spirit, for whatever that is worth to you.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: All I ask in return is that you take me home.

sequence.speaker: SPIRIT
sequence.text: If I can reclaim my home, my former subjects… my former people… they will not be a danger to you anymore. I’m certain of it.
